title: rirods vs iCommands
text: iCommand ipwd rirods counterpart ipwd() work exactly , providing path current working directory. case icd() different; unlike icd, returns “/zone/home” directory argument provided, icd() needs argument path new working directory. icd("/tempZone/home") take us "/tempZone/home" like icd might, icd() arguments throw error. comes listing contents collection, ils ils() can given path, , list contents working directory. Permissions can shown ils -argument ils() providing permissions=TRUE, although latter return information inheritance1. time item last modified size data objects shown ils -l ils(stats=TRUE). crucial difference ils ils() ils(metadata=TRUE) used print metadata information element listed, whereas iCommands provides metadata information one element time calling imeta ls . moment, rirods offer fast way restricting metadata specific item, although custom function filter_ils() shown used achieve result.
code: ils() # ils #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                         logical_path #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection #>   /tempZone/home/rods/200numbers.rds ils("some_collection") # ils some_collection #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                            logical_path #>       /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/subcollection #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/random_numbers.rds ils("some_collection", stat = TRUE) # ils -l some_collection #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                            logical_path inheritance_enabled #>       /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/subcollection               FALSE #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/random_numbers.rds                <NA> #>  status_code modified_at permissions.name permissions.perm permissions.type #>            0  1710617057             rods              own        rodsadmin #>            0  1710617057             rods              own        rodsadmin #>  permissions.zone registered        type checksum size #>          tempZone       TRUE  collection     <NA> <NA> #>          tempZone       TRUE data_object           832 ils("some_collection", permissions = TRUE) # ils -A some_collection #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                            logical_path #>       /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/subcollection #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/random_numbers.rds ils(permissions=TRUE, stat = TRUE) # ils -Al #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                         logical_path inheritance_enabled status_code #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection               FALSE           0 #>   /tempZone/home/rods/200numbers.rds                <NA>           0 #>  modified_at permissions.name permissions.perm permissions.type #>   1710617057             rods              own        rodsadmin #>   1710617058             rods              own        rodsadmin #>  permissions.zone registered        type checksum size #>          tempZone       TRUE  collection     <NA> <NA> #>          tempZone       TRUE data_object          1632 filter_ils <- function(pattern, ils_output = ils()) {   stopifnot(inherits(ils_output, "irods_df"))   ils_df <- as.data.frame(ils_output)   if (length(pattern) == 1) {     filtered <- ils_df[grepl(pattern, ils_df$logical_path), ]   } else {     filtered <- ils_df[basename(ils_df$logical_path) %in% pattern, ]   }   rirods:::new_irods_df(filtered) } my_files <- ils("some_collection", metadata = TRUE) my_files #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                            logical_path    attribute  value #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/random_numbers.rds distribution normal #>                                                               length    100 #>       /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/subcollection         <NA>   <NA> #>  units #>        #>        #>   <NA> filter_ils("random", my_files) # imeta ls -d some_collection/random_numbers.rds #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                            logical_path    attribute  value #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/random_numbers.rds distribution normal #>                                                               length    100 #>  units #>        #>

what: Creating and deleting collections or data objects
title: rirods vs iCommands
text: iCommands can create new collections data objects imkdir itouch respectively. former matched rirods imkdir(), latter covered R package yet. iCommands rirods, imkdir() requires path argument request creating parent collections: Removing data objects collections can achieved irm iCommands irm() rirods, functions force recursive arguments:
code: imkdir("new_collection") # imkdir new_collection ils() #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                         logical_path #>   /tempZone/home/rods/new_collection #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection #>   /tempZone/home/rods/200numbers.rds  # imkdir -p another_collection/subcollection imkdir("another_collection/subcollection", create_parent_collections = TRUE)  ils() #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                            logical_path #>  /tempZone/home/rods/another_collection #>      /tempZone/home/rods/new_collection #>     /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection #>      /tempZone/home/rods/200numbers.rds ils("another_collection") #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                          logical_path #>  /tempZone/home/rods/another_collection/subcollection irm("200numbers.rds", force = FALSE) # irm 200numbers.rds ils("/tempZone/trash/home/rods") #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                              logical_path #>  /tempZone/trash/home/rods/200numbers.rds  irm("another_collection", force = TRUE, recursive = TRUE) # irm -rf another_collection iquery("SELECT COLL_NAME WHERE COLL_NAME LIKE '%_collection'") #>                                           COLL_NAME #> 1                /tempZone/home/rods/new_collection #> 2               /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection #> 3 /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/subcollection

title: rirods vs iCommands
text: order transfer data local system iRODS, main iCommands iput iget, iput() iget() rirods counterparts. rirods functions much restricted don’t really offer variety arguments iCommands , options related HTTP requests. Moreover, require user provide local logical paths explicitly, whereas iCommands reuse source path default. words, iput myfile.txt take local file “myfile.txt” store iRODS working directory “myfile.txt”, iput("myfile.txt") throw error; iput("myfile.txt", "myfile.txt") correct syntax achieve desired effect: Next functions, rirods provides two functions store R objects directly iRODS read RDS files directly iRODS: isaveRDS() ireadRDS(). counterpart iCommands. achieve effect isaveRDS(), user first save object saveRDS(), send iRODS iput finally remove irm -f; vein, effect ireadRDS() achieved retrieving file iget, reading readRDS() removing local space. Read vignette("local-irods").

title: rirods vs iCommands
text: rirods imeta() function covers two main functionalities imeta iCommand: adding removing metadata data object collection. function three main arguments: logical path data object collection add metadata, entity type (e.g. “data_object”, default, “collection”) list operations, specified whether certain AVU added removed. order “modify” AVU rirods, remove add replacement. also illustrates can add/remove several AVUs one imeta() call, possible imeta2. mentioned , whereas iCommand imeta ls used list metadata item, ils(metadata=TRUE) used rirods instead. Finally, rirods equivalent iCommand iquest iquery(), GenQuery expression main argument compatible arguments. Given query variable “SELECT DATA_NAME, DATA_CHECKSUM COLL_NAME LIKE ‘/tempZone/home/rods%’”: learn imeta() iquery(), see vignette("metadata").
code: icd("some_collection") ils(metadata=TRUE) #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                            logical_path    attribute  value #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/random_numbers.rds distribution normal #>                                                               length    100 #>       /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/subcollection         <NA>   <NA> #>  units #>        #>        #>   <NA>  # imeta add -C subcollection foo bar baz imeta("subcollection",       operations = list(         list(operation="add", attribute="foo", value="bar", units="baz")         )       )  # imeta rm -d random_numbers.rds distribution normal imeta("random_numbers.rds",       operations = list(         list(operation="remove", attribute="distribution", value="normal")       ))  ils(metadata=TRUE) #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                            logical_path attribute value units #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/random_numbers.rds       foo   bar   baz #>       /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/subcollection       foo   bar   baz # imeta mod -d random_numbers.rds length 100 items u:elements imeta("random_numbers.rds",       operations = list(         list(operation="remove", attribute="length", value="100", units="items"),         list(operation="add", attribute="length", value="100", units="elements")       )) ils(metadata=TRUE) #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                            logical_path attribute value units #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/random_numbers.rds       foo   bar   baz #>       /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection/subcollection       foo   bar   baz

title: Accessing data locally and in iRODS
text: R can check working directory getwd() change setwd(dir), dir path want set new working directory. functions return current working directory; change invisibly case setwd(). rirods counterparts ipwd() (“print working directory”) icd(dir) (“change directory”) respectively. purposes vignette, ’ll use temporary directory locally. current output getwd() ipwd() respectively: can see contents dir(path) list.files(path) ils(path) respectively. path provided, current working directory used default: can focus “data” local directory setwd("data")1 “data” iRODS collection icd("data"). output getwd() ipwd(), respectively, updated, dir() ils() show contents “data” default. can reset working directories providing old path setwd() icd() respectively. Note moving upwards file system also possible providing “../” level want go: icd("../") changes iRODS working directory parent collection.
code: getwd() ipwd() dir() ils() old_local <- setwd("data") dir() old_irods <- icd("data") ils() setwd(old_local) getwd()  icd(old_irods) ipwd()

title: Accessing data locally and in iRODS
text: Directories can created R dir.create(path); collections can created iRODS imkdir(path) (“make directory”), providing path relative working directory. example, code creates “analysis” directory working directory, first locally iRODS.
code: dir.create("analysis") dir()  imkdir("analysis") ils()

title: Accessing data locally and in iRODS
text: R several R packages (readr) provide number functions save data locally. example, writeLines(some_vector, path) can used write vector text file one item per line; write.csv(dataframe, path) can used write dataframe comma-separated file; saveRDS(R_object, path) can used write R object RDS file. path can relative working directory absolute paths. example, let’s simulate data store “data” directory write.csv(). saving data iRODS, don’t kinds options. Instead, can either transfer file type local system iRODS iput(local_path, irods_path) save R object RDS file isaveRDS(some_object, irods_path). case simulated data, use first option: Note file name need stay local iRODS systems. Now, let’s say processed data linear regression modelling. certainly store output locally, also decide store iRODS save RDS format. let’s save “analysis” collection.
code: set.seed(1234) fake_data <- data.frame(x = rnorm(20, mean = 1)) fake_data$y <- fake_data$x * 2 + 3 - rnorm(20, sd = 0.6) write.csv(fake_data, file.path("data", "data.csv"), row.names = FALSE) dir("data") iput("data/data.csv", "data/data_from_local.csv") ils("data") m <- lm(y ~ x, data = fake_data) m isaveRDS(m, "analysis/linear_model.rds") ils("analysis") dir("analysis") # nothing was saved locally

title: Accessing data locally and in iRODS
text: Just like many different R functions save files different formats, specific functions read files different formats. just like rirods either save RDS format transfer files local system iRODS, either read RDS files transfer files back iRODS local system. want read “data_from_local.csv”, first need retrieve iget(irods_path, local_path) open appropriate R function. RDS files, also use iget() wanted store locally, simply ireadRDS(irods_path) read file directly.
code: iget("data/data_from_local.csv", "data/data_from_irods.csv") dir("data") read.csv("data/data_from_irods.csv") # same as fake_data # copy locally first iget("analysis/linear_model.rds", "analysis/linear_model_in_local.rds") dir("analysis") readRDS("analysis/linear_model_in_local.rds")  # or read directly from iRODS ireadRDS("analysis/linear_model.rds")

title: Accessing data locally and in iRODS
text: Finally, local data can removed unlink(path) file.remove(), whereas iRODS data can removed irm(path). unlink() irm() take optional argument recursive TRUE want remove directory/collection contents. case irm(), force argument also defines whether item deleted permanently , FALSE, sent “trash” collection.
code: unlink("analysis", recursive = TRUE) dir()  irm("data", recursive = TRUE, force = TRUE) ils()

title: Use iRODS metadata
text: background already started iRODS session demo server; home directory “/tempZone/home/rods” empty, ils() shows: illustration purposes, ’ll create data objects (.e. files). First, simulate study small dataframe linear model. store dataframe csv linear model RDS objects iRODS. csv file must stored locally first, two can directly streamed iRODS. add metadata=TRUE ils() call, see new data objects metadata attached .
code: ils() #> This collection does not contain any objects or collections. set.seed(1234) fake_data <- data.frame(x = rnorm(20, mean = 1)) fake_data$y <- fake_data$x * 2 + 3 - rnorm(20, sd = 0.6) m <- lm(y ~ x, data = fake_data) m #>  #> Call: #> lm(formula = y ~ x, data = fake_data) #>  #> Coefficients: #> (Intercept)            x   #>       3.249        2.130 data_path <- "data.csv" lm_path <- "analysis/linear_model.rds" write.csv(fake_data, data_path) # write locally iput(data_path, data_path) # transfer to iRODS imkdir("analysis") # create directory # save directly as rds isaveRDS(m, lm_path) ils(metadata=TRUE) #> No metadata #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                  logical_path #>  /tempZone/home/rods/analysis #>  /tempZone/home/rods/data.csv ils("analysis", metadata=TRUE) #> No metadata #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                   logical_path #>  /tempZone/home/rods/analysis/linear_model.rds

title: Use iRODS metadata
text: iRODS, metadata registered attribute name-value-unit triples (aka AVUs) attached collections data objects. add AVU rirods can use imeta() function, takes three main arguments: path collection data object, entity type (“data_object”, default, “collection”), list operations. operations must named lists vectors operation —indicates whether want “add” “remove” AVU— values attribute (name), value , optionally, units. example, let’s say want include number rows fake_data metadata field “nrow”. something like this1: can also several AVUs attribute name different values units item. example, might want code number rows columns metadata field “size”. Since old AVU necessary , can remove providing “remove” operation.
code: imeta(data_path, operations = list(   list(operation = "add", attribute = "nrow", value = as.character(nrow(fake_data)))   )) filter_ils(data_path, ils(metadata=TRUE)) #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                  logical_path attribute value units #>  /tempZone/home/rods/data.csv      nrow    20 imeta(data_path, operations = list(   list(operation = "add", attribute = "size", value = as.character(nrow(fake_data)), units = "rows"),   list(operation = "add", attribute = "size", value = as.character(length(fake_data)), units = "columns"),   list(operation = "remove", attribute = "nrow", value = as.character(nrow(fake_data)))   )) filter_ils(data_path, ils(metadata=TRUE)) #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                  logical_path attribute value   units #>  /tempZone/home/rods/data.csv      size     2 columns #>                                    size    20

title: Use iRODS metadata
text: Since dataframes lists lists, operations argument imeta() can also dataframe. Say, example, standard set metadata fields like add linear model: can just add column operation name add model data object:
code: lm_meta <- data.frame(   attribute = c("size", "size", "data_file", "model_type"),   value = c(as.character(nrow(fake_data)), 1, data_path, "linear regression"),   units = c("observations", "predictors", "", "") ) lm_meta #>    attribute             value        units #> 1       size                20 observations #> 2       size                 1   predictors #> 3  data_file          data.csv              #> 4 model_type linear regression lm_meta$operation <- "add" imeta(lm_path, operations = lm_meta) filter_ils("linear_model", ils("analysis", metadata=TRUE)) #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                   logical_path  attribute             value #>  /tempZone/home/rods/analysis/linear_model.rds  data_file          data.csv #>                                                model_type linear regression #>                                                      size                 1 #>                                                      size                20 #>  units #>        #>        #>        #>

title: Use iRODS metadata
text: want add metadata several items, however, need run one imeta() call per item, loop function purrr:::pmap():
code: file_md <- data.frame(   path = c(data_path, lm_path),   type = c("dataframe", "lm"),   responsible = c("abby", "bob") ) pwalk(file_md, function(path, type, responsible) {   imeta(path, operations = list(     list(       operation = "add",       attribute = "type",       value = type     ),     list(       operation = "add",       attribute = "responsible",       value = responsible     )   )) }) ils(metadata=TRUE) #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                  logical_path   attribute     value units #>  /tempZone/home/rods/analysis        <NA>      <NA>  <NA> #>  /tempZone/home/rods/data.csv responsible      abby       #>                                      size         2       #>                                      size        20       #>                                      type dataframe ils("analysis", metadata=TRUE) #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                                   logical_path   attribute             value #>  /tempZone/home/rods/analysis/linear_model.rds   data_file          data.csv #>                                                 model_type linear regression #>                                                responsible               bob #>                                                       size                 1 #>                                                       size                20 #>                                                       type                lm #>  units #>        #>        #>        #>        #>        #>

title: Use iRODS metadata
text: Adding metadata collection follows procedure, need specify entity type. reason specify data objects ’s default value.
code: imeta(   "analysis",   operations = list(     list(operation = "add", attribute = "dataset", value = data_path)   )) ils(metadata=TRUE) #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                  logical_path attribute    value units #>  /tempZone/home/rods/analysis   dataset data.csv       #>  /tempZone/home/rods/data.csv   dataset data.csv       #>                                 dataset data.csv       #>                                 dataset data.csv       #>                                 dataset data.csv

title: Use iRODS metadata
text: can query collections data objects based metadata iquery() providing GenQuery statement format "SELECT COL1, COL2, COLN... (CONDITION)". statement, “COL 1, COL2, COLN…” names columns database, .e. properties want obtain, optional condition “” provides filter based metadata collections data objects. example, query asks names parent collection data objects data objects access : output dataframe one row per result one column per information piece requested (case name collection “COLL_NAME” name data object “DATA_NAME”). Note query goes levels file system. query filters collections metadata attribute name (“META_COLL_ATTR_NAME”) beginning “data” retrieves names collection data objects (“COLL_NAME” “DATA_NAME”) well value said metadata item (“META_COLL_ATTR_VALUE”). also retrieve type information size data object creation/modification time collection, data object metadata. instance, query filters data objects metadata attribute “size” (“META_DATA_ATTR_NAME = ‘size’”) retrieves actual size bytes (“DATA_SIZE”) well value units metadata attribute (“META_DATA_ATTR_VALUE” “META_DATA_ATTR_UNITS”). Columns ending “SIZE” parsed numbers; way, columns ending “TIME” class “POSIXct”, .e. datetime objects. example, query retrieves parent collection’s name (“COLL_NAME”) name (“DATA_NAME”), creation time (“DATA_CREATE_TIME”) size bytes (“DATA_SIZE”) data objects whose parent collection name ends “analysis” less 8000 bytes size. number columns used selection filtering. ones ’ll probably find useful shown table : final tip request name parent collection data object , can concatenate obtain logical paths: Now ready describe data iRODS metadata find anything everything ils() iquery().
code: iquery("SELECT COLL_NAME, DATA_NAME") #>                      COLL_NAME        DATA_NAME #> 1          /tempZone/home/rods         data.csv #> 2 /tempZone/home/rods/analysis linear_model.rds #> 3    /tempZone/trash/home/rods   200numbers.rds iquery("SELECT COLL_NAME, DATA_NAME, META_COLL_ATTR_VALUE WHERE META_COLL_ATTR_NAME LIKE 'data%'") #>                      COLL_NAME        DATA_NAME META_COLL_ATTR_VALUE #> 1 /tempZone/home/rods/analysis linear_model.rds             data.csv iquery("SELECT DATA_NAME, DATA_SIZE, META_DATA_ATTR_VALUE, META_DATA_ATTR_UNITS WHERE META_DATA_ATTR_NAME = 'size'") #>          DATA_NAME DATA_SIZE META_DATA_ATTR_VALUE META_DATA_ATTR_UNITS #> 1         data.csv       798                    2              columns #> 2         data.csv       798                   20                 rows #> 3 linear_model.rds      3927                    1           predictors #> 4 linear_model.rds      3927                   20         observations iq <- iquery("SELECT COLL_NAME, DATA_NAME, DATA_CREATE_TIME, DATA_SIZE WHERE COLL_NAME LIKE '%analysis' AND DATA_SIZE < '8000'") iq #>                      COLL_NAME        DATA_NAME    DATA_CREATE_TIME DATA_SIZE #> 1 /tempZone/home/rods/analysis linear_model.rds 2024-03-16 19:24:32      3927 class(iq$DATA_CREATE_TIME) #> [1] "POSIXct" "POSIXt" class(iq$DATA_SIZE) #> [1] "numeric" iq$PATH <- file.path(iq$COLL_NAME, iq$DATA_NAME) iq #>                      COLL_NAME        DATA_NAME    DATA_CREATE_TIME DATA_SIZE #> 1 /tempZone/home/rods/analysis linear_model.rds 2024-03-16 19:24:32      3927 #>                                            PATH #> 1 /tempZone/home/rods/analysis/linear_model.rds

title: R Client for iRODS
text: can install latest CRAN version rirods like : , development version GitHub, like :
code: install.packages("rirods") # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("irods/irods_client_library_rirods")

title: R Client for iRODS
text: package connects iRODS C++ HTTP API - https://github.com/irods/irods_client_http_api. Launch local demonstration iRODS service (including HTTP API): result demonstration HTTP API running http://localhost:9001/irods-http-api/0.2.0. Docker containers designed easily stand DEMONSTRATION iRODS server. intended education exploration. (See also vignette("demo").) USE PRODUCTION
code: # load library(rirods) # setup a mock iRODS server (https://github.com/irods/irods_demo) use_irods_demo("alice", "passWORD")

title: R Client for iRODS
text: connect HTTP API endpoint choice, load rirods, connect create_irods(), authenticate iRODS credentials:
code: create_irods("http://localhost:9001/irods-http-api/0.2.0")

title: R Client for iRODS
text: example Alice user iRODS can authenticate iauth("alice"). prompts dialog can enter password without hardcoding information scripts.
code: # login as alice with password "passWORD" iauth("alice") # or iauth("alice", "passWORD")

title: R Client for iRODS
text: Suppose Alice like upload R object current R session iRODS collection. , use isaveRDS() command:
code: # some data foo <- data.frame(x = c(1, 8, 9), y = c("x", "y", "z"))  # check where we are in the iRODS namespace ipwd() #> [1] "/tempZone/home/alice"  # store data in iRODS isaveRDS(foo, "foo.rds")

title: R Client for iRODS
text: truly appreciate strength iRODS, can add metadata describes data object “foo”: using metadata, check vignette("metadata").
code: # add some metadata imeta(   "foo.rds",    operations =      data.frame(operation = "add", attribute = "foo", value = "bar", units = "baz") )  # check if file is stored with associated metadata ils(metadata = TRUE) #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                  logical_path attribute value units #>  /tempZone/home/alice/foo.rds       foo   bar   baz

title: R Client for iRODS
text: Alice wanted copy foo R object iRODS collection current R session, use ireadRDS():
code: # retrieve in native R format ireadRDS("foo.rds") #>   x y #> 1 1 x #> 2 8 y #> 3 9 z

title: R Client for iRODS
text: Possibly Alice want native R object stored iRODS file type can accessed programs. , use iput() command: Later somebody else might want download file store locally:
code: library(readr)  # creates a csv file of foo write_csv(foo, "foo.csv")  # send file iput("foo.csv", "foo.csv")  # check whether it is stored ils() #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                  logical_path #>  /tempZone/home/alice/foo.csv #>  /tempZone/home/alice/foo.rds # retrieve it again later iget("foo.csv", "foo.csv") read_csv("foo.csv") #> Rows: 3 Columns: 2 #> ── Column specification ──────────────────────────────────────────────────────── #> Delimiter: "," #> chr (1): y #> dbl (1): x #>  #> ℹ Use `spec()` to retrieve the full column specification for this data. #> ℹ Specify the column types or set `show_col_types = FALSE` to quiet this message. #> # A tibble: 3 × 2 #>       x y     #>   <dbl> <chr> #> 1     1 x     #> 2     8 y     #> 3     9 z

title: R Client for iRODS
text: adding metadata others can easily discover data future projects. Objects can searched General Queries iquery(): querying, check vignette("metadata").
code: # look for objects in the home collection with a wildcard `%` iquery("SELECT COLL_NAME, DATA_NAME WHERE COLL_NAME LIKE '/tempZone/home/%'") #>              COLL_NAME DATA_NAME #> 1 /tempZone/home/alice   foo.csv #> 2 /tempZone/home/alice   foo.rds  # or for data objects with a name that starts with "foo" iquery("SELECT COLL_NAME, DATA_NAME WHERE DATA_NAME LIKE 'foo%'") #>              COLL_NAME DATA_NAME #> 1 /tempZone/home/alice   foo.csv #> 2 /tempZone/home/alice   foo.rds

title: R Client for iRODS
text: Finally, can clean Alice’s home collection:
code: # delete object irm("foo.rds", force = TRUE) irm("foo.csv", force = TRUE)  # check if objects are removed ils() #> This collection does not contain any objects or collections.  # close the server stop_irods_demo() # optionally remove the Docker images # irods:::remove_docker_images()

what: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
text: Coerce iRODS Zone information class data.frame().

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
code: # S3 method for irods_df as.data.frame(x, ...)

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
text: x irods_df class object. ... Currently implemented

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
text: Returns data.frame. Note, columns metadata consists list data frames, status_information permission_information consist data frames.

title: Coerce to a Data Frame — as.data.frame.irods_df
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE # \dontshow{ .old_config_dir <- Sys.getenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR") Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = tempdir()) # } # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost:9001/irods-http-api/0.2.0", overwrite = TRUE)  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods")  # some data foo <- data.frame(x = c(1, 8, 9), y = c("x", "y", "z"))  # store data in iRODS isaveRDS(foo, "foo.rds")  # add some metadata imeta(   "foo.rds",   operations =     data.frame(operation = "add", attribute = "foo", value = "bar",       units = "baz") )  # iRODS Zone with metadata irods_zone <- ils(metadata = TRUE)  # check class class(irods_zone) #> [1] "irods_df"  # coerce into `data.frame` and extract metadata of "foo.rds" irods_zone <- as.data.frame(irods_zone) irods_zone[basename(irods_zone$logical_path) == "foo.rds", "metadata"] #> NULL  # delete object irm("foo.rds", force = TRUE) # \dontshow{ Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = .old_config_dir) # }

title: Generate IRODS Configuration File — create_irods
text: create iRODS configuration file containing information iRODS server. file created, future sessions connect iRODS server without intervention.

title: Generate IRODS Configuration File — create_irods
code: create_irods(host, zone_path = character(1), overwrite = FALSE)

title: Generate IRODS Configuration File — create_irods
text: host URL host. zone_path Deprecated overwrite Overwrite existing iRODS configuration file. Defaults FALSE.

title: Generate IRODS Configuration File — create_irods
text: Invisibly, path iRODS configuration file.

title: Generate IRODS Configuration File — create_irods
text: configuration file located user-specific configuration directory. destination set R_USER_CONFIG_DIR set. Otherwise, follows platform conventions (see also rappdirs::user_config_dir()).

what: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
title: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
text: Note function can used admin rights.

title: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
code: iadmin(   name,   password = character(1),   action = c("create_user", "set_password", "remove_user"),   role = c("rodsuser", "groupadmin", "rodsadmin"),   verbose = FALSE )

title: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
text: name Name user added. password Password added. action action: "create_user", "remove_user", "set_password". role Role user: "rodsuser", "groupadmin", "groupadmin". verbose Show information http request response. Defaults FALSE.

title: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
text: Invisible http status.

title: The Administration Interface to iRODS — iadmin
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo() # \dontshow{ .old_config_dir <- Sys.getenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR") Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = tempdir()) # } # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost:9001/irods-http-api/0.2.0", overwrite = TRUE)  # authentication iauth("rods", "rods")  # add user iadmin("Alice", action = "create_user", role = "rodsuser")  # add user password iadmin("Alice", "pass", action = "set_password",  role = "rodsuser")  # delete user iadmin("Alice", action = "remove_user", role = "rodsuser") # \dontshow{ Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = .old_config_dir) # }

what: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
title: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
text: Provides authentication service iRODS zone. Using function without arguments results prompt asking user name password thereby preventing hard-coding sensitive information scripts.

title: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
code: iauth(user, password = NULL, role = "rodsuser")

title: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
text: user iRODS user name (prompts user user name supplied). password iRODS password (prompts user password supplied). role iRODS role user (defaults "rodsuser").

title: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
text: Invisibly NULL.

title: Authentication Service for an iRODS Zone — iauth
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo() # \dontshow{ .old_config_dir <- Sys.getenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR") Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = tempdir()) # } # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost:9001/irods-http-api/0.2.0", overwrite = TRUE)  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods") # \dontshow{ Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = .old_config_dir) # }

what: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
title: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
text: ipwd() icd() iRODS equivalents getwd() setwd() respectively. example, whereas getwd() returns current working directory local system, ipwd() returns current working directory iRODS.

title: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
code: icd(dir)  ipwd()

title: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
text: dir Collection set working directory.

title: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
text: Invisibly current directory change (convention setwd()).

title: Get or Set Current Working Directory in iRODS — icd
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE # \dontshow{ .old_config_dir <- Sys.getenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR") Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = tempdir()) # } # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost:9001/irods-http-api/0.2.0", overwrite = TRUE)  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods", "rodsadmin")  # default dir icd(".") ipwd() #> [1] "/tempZone"  # relative paths work as well icd("/tempZone/home") ipwd() #> [1] "/tempZone/home"  # go back on level lower icd("..") ipwd() #> [1] "/tempZone"  # absolute paths work as well icd("/tempZone/home/rods") ipwd() #> [1] "/tempZone/home/rods"  # back home icd("/tempZone/home") # \dontshow{ Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = .old_config_dir) # }

what: Retrieve File or Object from iRODS — iget
title: Retrieve File or Object from iRODS — iget
text: Transfer file iRODS local storage iget() read R object RDS file iRODS ireadRDS() (see readRDS()).

title: Retrieve File or Object from iRODS — iget
code: iget(   logical_path,   local_path,   offset = 0,   count = 0,   verbose = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE,   ticket = NULL )  ireadRDS(logical_path, offset = 0, count = 0, verbose = FALSE, ticket = NULL)

title: Retrieve File or Object from iRODS — iget
text: logical_path Source path iRODS. local_path Destination path local storage. default, basename logical path; file stored current directory (see getwd()). offset Offset bytes data object. Deprecated. count Maximum number bytes write. Deprecated. verbose Whether information printed HTTP request response. overwrite Whether local file overwritten exists. Defaults FALSE. ticket valid iRODS ticket string. Defaults NULL.

title: Retrieve File or Object from iRODS — iget
text: R object case ireadRDS(), invisibly NULL case iget(). R object case ireadRDS(), invisibly NULL case iget().

what: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
title: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
text: List contents collection, optionally stat, metadata, /access control information element collection.

title: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
code: ils(   logical_path = ".",   stat = FALSE,   permissions = FALSE,   metadata = FALSE,   offset = numeric(1),   limit = find_irods_file("max_number_of_rows_per_catalog_query"),   recurse = FALSE,   ticket = NULL,   message = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
text: logical_path Path collection whose contents listed. default current working collection (see ipwd()). stat Whether stat information included. Defaults FALSE. permissions Whether access control information included. Defaults FALSE. metadata Whether metadata information included. Defaults FALSE. offset Number records skip pagination. Deprecated. limit Number records show per page. recurse Recursively list. Defaults FALSE. ticket valid iRODS ticket string. Defaults NULL. message Show message empty collection. Default FALSE. verbose Whether information printed HTTP request response. Defaults FALSE.

title: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
text: Dataframe logical paths , requested, additional information.

title: List iRODS Data Objects and Collections — ils
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE # \dontshow{ .old_config_dir <- Sys.getenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR") Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = tempdir()) # } # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost:9001/irods-http-api/0.2.0", overwrite = TRUE)  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods")  # list home directory ils() #> This collection does not contain any objects or collections.  # make collection imkdir("some_collection")  # list a different directory ils("/tempZone/home/rods/some_collection") #> This collection does not contain any objects or collections.  # show metadata ils(metadata = TRUE) #> No metadata #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                         logical_path #>  /tempZone/home/rods/some_collection  # delete `some_collection` irm("some_collection", force = TRUE, recursive = TRUE) # \dontshow{ Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = .old_config_dir) # }

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
text: iRODS, metadata stored attribute-value-units triples (AVUs), consisting attribute name, attribute value optional unit. function allows chain several operations ('add' 'remove') linked specific AVUs. Read metadata looking iCommands equivalent imeta iRODS Docs.

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
code: imeta(   logical_path,   entity_type = c("data_object", "collection", "user"),   operations = list(),   admin = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
text: logical_path Path data object collection (name user). entity_type Type item add metadata remove . Options 'data_object', 'collection' 'user'.  Deprecated. operations List named lists data.frame representing operations. valid components lists vectors : operation, values 'add' 'remove', depending whether AVU added removed metadata item (required). attribute, name AVU (required). value, value AVU (required). units, unit AVU (optional). admin Whether grant admin rights. Defaults FALSE. verbose Whether information printed HTTP request response. Defaults FALSE.

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
text: Invisibly, HTTP response.

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
text: https://docs.irods.org/master/icommands/metadata/

title: Add or Remove Metadata — imeta
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE  # demonstration server (requires Bash, Docker and Docker-compose) # use_irods_demo() # \dontshow{ .old_config_dir <- Sys.getenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR") Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = tempdir()) # } # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost:9001/irods-http-api/0.2.0", overwrite = TRUE)  # authentication iauth("rods", "rods")  # some data foo <- data.frame(x = c(1, 8, 9), y = c("x", "y", "z"))  # store isaveRDS(foo, "foo.rds")  # check if file is stored ils() #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                 logical_path #>  /tempZone/home/rods/foo.rds  # add some metadata imeta(   "foo.rds",    operations =     list(      list(operation = "add", attribute = "foo", value = "bar", units = "baz")    ) )  # `operations` can contain multiple tags supplied as a `data.frame` imeta(   "foo.rds",   operations = data.frame(     operation = c("add", "add"),     attribute = c("foo2", "foo3"),     value = c("bar2", "bar3"),     units = c("baz2", "baz3")    )  )  # or again as a list of lists imeta(   "foo.rds",   operations = list(     list(operation = "add", attribute = "foo4", value = "bar4", units = "baz4"),     list(operation = "add", attribute = "foo5", value = "bar5", units = "baz5")   ) )  # list of lists are useful as AVUs don't have to contain units imeta(   "foo.rds",   operations = list(     list(operation = "add", attribute = "foo6", value = "bar6"),     list(operation = "add", attribute = "foo7", value = "bar7", units = "baz7")   ) )  # check if file is stored with associated metadata ils(metadata = TRUE) #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                 logical_path attribute value units #>  /tempZone/home/rods/foo.rds       foo   bar   baz #>                                   foo2  bar2       #>                                   foo3  bar3       #>                                   foo4  bar4       #>                                   foo5  bar5       #>                                   foo6  bar6       #>                                   foo7  bar7        # delete object irm("foo.rds", force = TRUE) # \dontshow{ Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = .old_config_dir) # }

what: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
title: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
text: Store object file iRODS. iput() used transfer file local storage iRODS; isaveRDS() saves R object current environment iRODS RDS format (see saveRDS()).

title: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
code: iput(   local_path,   logical_path,   offset = 0,   count = 0,   truncate = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE,   ticket = NULL )  isaveRDS(   x,   logical_path,   offset = 0,   count = 0,   truncate = TRUE,   verbose = FALSE,   overwrite = FALSE,   ticket = NULL )

title: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
text: local_path Local path file sent iRODS. logical_path Destination path iRODS. offset Offset bytes data object. Deprecated. count Maximum number bytes write. Deprecated. truncate Whether truncate object opening . Deprecated. verbose Whether print information HTTP request response. Defaults FALSE. overwrite Whether file iRODS overwritten exists. Defaults FALSE. ticket valid iRODS ticket string. Defaults NULL. x R object save iRODS.

title: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
text: (Invisibly) HTTP response.

title: Save Files and Objects in iRODS — iput
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE # \dontshow{ .old_config_dir <- Sys.getenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR") .old_wd <- setwd(tempdir()) Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = tempdir()) # } # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost:9001/irods-http-api/0.2.0", overwrite = TRUE)  # authenticate iauth("rods", "rods")  # save the iris dataset as csv and send the file to iRODS write.csv(iris, "iris.csv") iput("iris.csv", "iris.csv")  # save with a different name iput("iris.csv", "iris_in_irods.csv") ils() #>  #> ========== #> iRODS Zone #> ========== #>                           logical_path #>           /tempZone/home/rods/iris.csv #>  /tempZone/home/rods/iris_in_irods.csv  # send an R object to iRODS in RDS format isaveRDS(iris, "iris_in_rds.rds")  # delete objects in iRODS irm("iris_in_irods.csv", force = TRUE) irm("iris_in_rds.rds", force = TRUE) irm("iris.csv", force = TRUE)  # \dontshow{ setwd(.old_wd) Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = .old_config_dir) # }

what: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
title: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
text: Use SQL-like expressions query data objects collections based different properties. Read queries looking iCommands equivalent iquest iRODS Docs.

title: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
code: iquery(   query,   limit = 100,   offset = 0,   type = c("general", "specific"),   case_sensitive = TRUE,   distinct = TRUE,   parser = c("genquery1", "genquery2"),   sql_only = FALSE,   verbose = FALSE )

title: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
text: query GeneralQuery searching iCAT database. limit Maximum number rows return. offset Number rows skip paging. Deprecated. type Type query: 'general' (default) 'specific'. case_sensitive Whether string matching query case sensitive. Defaults TRUE. distinct Whether distinct rows listed. Defaults TRUE. parser parser use: genquery1 genquery2. Defaults genquery1. sql_only Whether dry-run query return SQL syntax query return. Defaults FALSE. Needs Genquery2. verbose Whether information printed HTTP request response.

title: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
text: dataframe one row per result one column per requested attribute, "size" "time" columns parsed right type. Invisibly, HTTP response.

title: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
text: https://docs.irods.org/master/icommands/user/#iquest Use SQL-like expressions query data objects collections based different properties.

title: Query Data Objects and Collections in iRODS — iquery
code: is_irods_demo_running() #> [1] TRUE # \dontshow{ .old_config_dir <- Sys.getenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR") Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = tempdir()) # } # connect project to server create_irods("http://localhost:9001/irods-http-api/0.2.0", overwrite = TRUE)  # authentication iauth("rods", "rods")  # some data foo <- data.frame(x = c(1, 8, 9), y = c("x", "y", "z"))  # store isaveRDS(foo, "foo.rds")  # add metadata imeta(   "foo.rds",   operations =     list(       list(operation = "add", attribute = "bar", value = "baz")   ) )  # search for objects by metadata iquery("SELECT COLL_NAME, DATA_NAME WHERE META_DATA_ATTR_NAME LIKE 'bar%'") #>             COLL_NAME DATA_NAME #> 1 /tempZone/home/rods   foo.rds  # delete object irm("foo.rds", force = TRUE) # \dontshow{ Sys.setenv("R_USER_CONFIG_DIR" = .old_config_dir) # }
